config_description: How long the coordinator should wait for seq or index scans to complete. Lowest acceptable value is 10 ms.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'range_request_timeout_in_ms' is used to determine how long the coordinator should wait for sequential or index scans to complete. It is accessed through the 'getRangeRpcTimeout' method in the code.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a range request is made in the system, specifically when the coordinator needs to wait for sequential or index scans to complete.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'range_request_timeout_in_ms' configuration option is that it determines the maximum time the coordinator will wait for range requests to complete. Setting it too low may result in incomplete scans, while setting it too high may lead to longer wait times for requests to finish.
